planets.name: Coruscant
planets.quote: The entire planet is one big city.
planets.notes: An ecumenopolis spanning the globe, serving as the political capital across eras. Its lowest levels are centuries old and home to the underworld.

planets.name: Alderaan
planets.quote: Alderaan is peaceful. We have no weapons.
planets.notes: A pacifist, mountainous world renowned for art and diplomacy. Destroyed by the first Death Star in 0 BBY.

planets.name: Corellia
planets.quote: Chewie, get us outta here!
planets.notes: Shipbuilding powerhouse—home of Corellian Engineering Corporation. Corellians are famed for fast ships and independent streaks.

planets.name: Chandrila
planets.quote: The Republic needs a strong, steady hand.
planets.notes: An agrarian core world known for civic freedoms. Became the first capital of the New Republic after the Battle of Endor.

planets.name: Brentaal
planets.quote: Commerce flows where lanes meet.
planets.notes: A chokepoint on the Perlemian with guild-dominated politics. Control of Brentaal means leverage over Core–Rim shipping.

planets.name: Cato Neimoidia
planets.quote: Everything of value is secured on purse worlds.
planets.notes: Bridge-cities cling to natural arches above the valleys. One of several worlds used to store Neimoidian fortunes.

planets.name: Kuat
planets.quote: From this ring, empires are forged.
planets.notes: A ring-shaped megastructure encircles the planet, building capital ships from the Clone Wars through the Imperial era.

planets.name: Duro
planets.quote: We were among the first to chart the stars.
planets.notes: Its surface was polluted into ruin; most citizens live in vast orbital habitats and shipyards.

planets.name: Commenor
planets.quote: Trade is our lifeblood.
planets.notes: Prosperous port world on busy lanes; its neutrality drew both Imperial and New Republic attention.

planets.name: Bothawui
planets.quote: Many Bothans died to bring us this information.
planets.notes: The Bothans operate influential intelligence networks from this world, shaping events far beyond the Mid Rim.

planets.name: Ord Mantell
planets.quote: Lots of strange stuff rolling through Ord Mantell.
planets.notes: Junkyards and mercenary outfits sprawl near the starports; a magnet for fringe work and salvagers.

planets.name: Mon Cala
planets.quote: It’s a trap!
planets.notes: Oceanic world of the Mon Calamari and Quarren. Their star cruisers helped tip the war to the Rebel Alliance.

planets.name: Takodana
planets.quote: I have seen the same eyes in different people.
planets.notes: Ancient neutral ground where smugglers, rogues, and wanderers converge at Maz’s lakeside castle.

planets.name: Cantonica
planets.quote: The stables are for fathiers, not financiers.
planets.notes: Glittering casinos hide arms dealing and exploitation; Resistance agents sought help and found lessons instead.

planets.name: Onderon
planets.quote: Freedom is won, not given.
planets.notes: A jungle world with a fierce independent streak. Its moon Dxun shares an atmosphere with the planet.

planets.name: Balmorra
planets.quote: If it moves, we can arm it.
planets.notes: Industrial world turning out arms and walkers for successive galactic governments.

planets.name: Geonosis
planets.quote: The first battle of the Clone Wars began here.
planets.notes: Petrified spires house hive cities and droid foundries. The Death Star’s early work began in Geonosian hands.

planets.name: Tatooine
planets.quote: You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy.
planets.notes: Twin-sunned desert world of moisture farms and Hutt influence. Spaceports like Mos Eisley attract smugglers and bounty hunters.

planets.name: Ryloth
planets.quote: Ryloth endures.
planets.notes: Tidally locked, with habitable twilight bands between a scorching day side and frozen night side.

planets.name: Mustafar
planets.quote: I have the high ground!
planets.notes: Volcanic world of fire rivers and mining colonies. Site of Skywalker and Kenobi’s fateful duel; later home to Vader’s fortress.

planets.name: Utapau
planets.quote: He is here—General Kenobi!
planets.notes: Vast sinkholes shelter cities connected by wind‑scarred bridges; critical Clone Wars engagement.

planets.name: Felucia
planets.quote: The wilderness glows after sundown.
planets.notes: A lush, bioluminescent jungle world; Jedi Master Secura fell here during Order 66.

planets.name: Saleucami
planets.quote: Sieges wore the planet thin.
planets.notes: Patchwork terrain of deserts and oases; major fortifications during the Outer Rim Sieges.

planets.name: Bespin
planets.quote: This deal is getting worse all the time.
planets.notes: Gas giant rich in tibanna gas. Cloud City’s platforms float in the upper atmosphere.

planets.name: Hoth
planets.quote: The shield will be down in moments. You may start your landing.
planets.notes: Glacial world where the Rebel Alliance briefly headquartered before an Imperial assault forced evacuation.

planets.name: Endor
planets.quote: Yub nub!
planets.notes: Forest moon whose shield generator protected the second Death Star; victory here toppled the Empire.

planets.name: Dagobah
planets.quote: Do or do not. There is no try.
planets.notes: Remote swamp planet teeming with life, masked in the Force by its natural vergence—ideal for hiding.

planets.name: Yavin IV
planets.quote: Red Leader, this is Gold Leader. We’re starting our attack run.
planets.notes: Jungle moon with ancient Massassi temples used as a Rebel base to strike the first Death Star.

planets.name: Lothal
planets.quote: Lothal belongs to its people.
planets.notes: Agrarian world forced into Imperial industrialization. Liberation sparked a broader rebellion in the sector.

planets.name: Scarif
planets.quote: Make ten men feel like a hundred.
planets.notes: Tropical Imperial archive where the Death Star plans were stolen at great cost.

planets.name: Dantooine
planets.quote: There’s an old Rebel base on Dantooine.
planets.notes: Pastoral world used early by the Alliance. Later reports of the base misled the Empire at a critical moment.

planets.name: Kessel
planets.quote: Tighten those navcalculations—we’re skimming the Maw.
planets.notes: Harsh prison‑mines of spice. The Kessel Run skirts black holes and the Akkadese Maelstrom.

planets.name: Eriadu
planets.quote: Eriadu rewards strength.
planets.notes: Industrial powerhouse and political base of Grand Moff Tarkin, anchoring the Hydian Way.

planets.name: Kamino
planets.quote: The first production runs are on schedule.
planets.notes: Ocean world of cloners who created the Grand Army for the Republic using Jango Fett’s template.

planets.name: Rishi
planets.quote: Rishi Station… we’ve got droids!
planets.notes: Strategic listening post guarding approaches to Kamino along the sea‑lanes.

planets.name: Sullust
planets.quote: The fleet is assembling at Sullust.
planets.notes: Volcanic caverns host industry and starfighter production. The Rebel fleet staged here before Endor.

planets.name: Mandalore
planets.quote: This is the Way.
planets.notes: A beskar-rich world with a warrior culture fractured by civil strife and Imperial purges.

planets.name: Concordia
planets.quote: The mines are not as abandoned as they seem.
planets.notes: A quiet Mandalorian moon used as a hidden base and mining site.

planets.name: Nevarro
planets.quote: I can bring you in warm, or I can bring you in cold.
planets.notes: Guild-controlled frontier world that shifted from scum hub to fledgling trade port.

planets.name: Ilum
planets.quote: The crystal chooses the Jedi… or the Sith.
planets.notes: Source of kyber for generations of lightsabers. Later hollowed out by the First Order into Starkiller Base.

planets.name: Ahch-To
planets.quote: It’s time for the Jedi to end.
planets.notes: Remote ocean world of rocky islets and ancient temples—the site of the first Jedi Temple.

planets.name: Exegol
planets.quote: The dark side is a pathway to many abilities…
planets.notes: Hidden storm-wracked world whose shipyards built the Final Order fleet in secret.

planets.name: Jakku
planets.quote: Some junk is not just junk.
planets.notes: Desert planet littered with starship hulks from the battle that ended the Galactic Civil War.

planets.name: Naboo
planets.quote: I will not condone a course of action that will lead us to war.
planets.notes: Idyllic lakes and Gungan swamps surround the city of Theed. Both a Queen and an Emperor hail from here.

planets.name: Rodia
planets.quote: Going somewhere, Solo?
planets.notes: Humid wetlands and dense jungles; Rodian culture prizes the hunt and clan prestige.

planets.name: Batuu
planets.quote: Bright suns!
planets.notes: Edge-of-wild-space refueling post beneath ancient petrified trees, crossroads of old sub-hyperspace routes.

planets.name: Crait
planets.quote: The spark that will light the fire.
planets.notes: Salt flats over crimson minerals set the stage for the Resistance’s daring escape.

planets.name: D'Qar
planets.quote: Clear the ion cannon for launch!
planets.notes: Jungle world whose hidden base served the Resistance until a heavy First Order strike.

planets.name: Polis Massa
planets.quote: We can still save the children.
planets.notes: An asteroid research facility that became the secret birthplace of Luke and Leia.

planets.name: Eadu
planets.quote: The work has to stop.
planets.notes: Storm-lashed laboratories refined kyber for the Death Star before Rebel strikes disrupted the project.

planets.name: Serenno
planets.quote: I serve a higher cause than the Republic.
planets.notes: Aristocratic world with old money and Separatist leadership; its estates funded galactic intrigue.

planets.name: Mygeeto
planets.quote: Hold the line!
planets.notes: Icy banking world and battlefield of Order 66 where Master Mundi fell.
